content: @BalÃ¡zs Pataki is fast redeploy still working for you? If memory serves it stopped working for you on IntelliJ. Then it stopped working for me on Netbeans. They my computer got wiped. I'm thinking about trying to get it working on VS Code (#10156).

Yes, it didn't really work after some IntelliJ updates - a plugin I used became incompatible. I haven't worked much on the Dataverse code these months so I didn't really need it, but should fix it or come up with a new way to do it.
Any interest in trying to get it working with VS Code?
I never worked in VS Code with Java ... But I know all the good AI coding agents are there :-)
Ok. I think @Eryk Kulikowski got it working.
I'm going to move these messages to a dedicated topic about VS Code.
6 messages were moved here from #containers > meetings by Philip Durbin ðŸš€.
A message was moved from this topic to #containers > fast redeploy with IntelliJ by Philip Durbin ðŸš€.

@Eryk Kulikowski I tried to deploy to Docker but I got an error. Details in this commit: https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/issues/10156#issuecomment-3432411553

Any luck? Is it working for you? :sweat_smile:

I opened this bug: https://github.com/payara/ecosystem-support/issues/99

And I added some more notes: https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/commit/22366cb4853951ea451efc9a4cdceff28fcd0ee2

Still not working but at least the "connect" button in VS Code works. It can connect to the instance of Payara in our containers.

Yesterday at tech hours I checked in with @Eryk Kulikowski about fast redeploy using VS Code and while he said he hasn't gotten it working he did offer an IDE-independent solution. I started a dedicated topic about it: #dev > fast redeploy with docker compose.
